Yes, the answers were indeed lacking.  By the way, notice also how 
they ig=
nored the second part of my question: "How can evolution 
search a space of=
 such astronomical complexity?"

I was really disappointed that they didn't=
 even venture into that 
issue, because that's the really interesting quest=
ion.  Of course you 
can always speculate on how a little can be converted =
to a lot by 
talking about fractals and subroutines (after all, that's just=
 
compression), but when you realize that we are talking about 
*searching*=
 a space of such mappings, it becomes far more complicated 
and profound.  =
The problem then becomes compounded by the fact that 
not only must the rep=
resentation be efficient but it must also warp 
in meaningful ways, e.g. a =
biped should have biped children.  How 
does natural evolution manage to in=
duce such a nicely structured 
search space?  Not a word was said on the ma=
tter.

ken
